description:
M31 - Andromeda Galaxy shot remotely from my system in Marathon Remote Imaging Observatory (MaRIO) in Marathon, TX.
This image has been a bit of a pain for me. This should have been a single panel image but turned into a 2 panel mosaic. After processing the first panel data, I realized I had a pretty pronounced reflection on the right hand side. Bad enough that I was never going to be able to clean it up. So I had to shoot another panel with roughly the same integration time to mask back in the correct details. But I felt this image was worth it to gather the additional data and make it look right.
I will enter in only the main data so I don't skew the numbers. Main image was 24.17 hours and the second panel was 20.83 hours for a total of 45 hours to capture this.

Software used to capture image:
Sequence Generator Pro
PHD2

Software used to edit:
PixInsight
Astro Pixel Processor
Photoshop

Total data gathered:
Main Panel: (145) Subs @ 600secs - 1x1 @ Gain 2200
Second Panel: (125) Subs @ 600secs - 1x1 @ Gain 2200


Camera : QHYCCD QHY128C
Telescope: Stellarvue SVQ86
Mount: AP Mach1GTO
title: Andromeda Galaxy with Ha Clouds
